intro: Coccoloba mornicola, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Coccoloba mornicola is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
